page.title: 18ENTERTAINMENT
page.content: Watching television, live or with video recordings,is the main form of entertainment in the area, and most people's set seem to be on permanently from teatime until bedtime. BBC and Border are the two most popular channels. The cinema in Penrith is used rarely and only when a major or well publicized film is shown and very few people travel to other centres to see films. 'Going for a drink' with perhaps a bar meal is a popular evening out withlocal inns competing for trade. The Crown and Kings Arms at Morland and the Golden Pheasant at Cliburn have a small group of regulars who play darts,pool and dominoes. The village hall,church and school provide a small but well supported programme of activities for all ages.
